profiledesc.creation: Finding aid exported into EAD from InMagic DB/Textworks 7.01. Encoded by Margaret Jessup. 2006-12-01

did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract: Materials collected by Ann Rollins about women's activism (especially for peace and the environment) in Australia, New Zealand, Canada, and the United Kingdom. Include subject files, memorabilia, posters, books, articles, clippings, maps, periodicals, flyers, and pamphlets. NOTE: There is no container list online for this finding aid. You may contact the Sophia Smith Collection if you want one sent to you.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ann Rollins compiled this collection on international feminism, having primarily to do with feminist activism in Austalia, Canada, Ireland, and the United Kingdom.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Ann Rollins Papers consist of a subject files, memorabilia, posters, books, articles, clippings, maps, periodicals, flyers, and pamphlets about women's activism (especially for peace and the environment) in Australia, New Zealand, Canada, and the United Kingdom. There is also a small amount (circa 1 folder) of personal material.
NOTE: There is no container list online for this finding aid. You may contact the Sophia Smith Collection if you want one sent to you.

accessrestrict.p: The papers are open to research according to the regulations of the Sophia Smith Collection.
This collection has not been fully processed and therefore may be difficult to use.

userestrict.p: Copyright to unpublished materials may be owned by the creator, or their heirs or assigns. It is the responsibility of the researcher to identify and satisfy the holders of all copyrights. Permission to publish reproductions or quotations beyond "fair use" must also be obtained from the Sophia Smith Collection as owners of the physical property.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Ann Rollins Papers, Sophia Smith Collection, Smith College, Northampton, Mass.
